protocol_name: Fluorometric real-time quantification of in vivo fluorescence in E. coli
protocol_name_html: Fluorometric real-time quantification of in vivo fluorescence in E. coli

materials.reagent_name: Costar 96 clear bottom black side plates

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Prepare o/n culture of each 3 independent clones

 

  • add 5 mL of LB medium to a sterile culture tube
  • add the appropriate amount of antibiotic(s)
  • use a sterile inoculation needle, pipette tip or toothpick to pick a colony from the Agar plate
  • gently whirl the tip in the medium (or drop it)
  • incubate at 37 °C and 230 rpm
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare o/n culture of each 3 independent clones

 

  • add 5 mL of LB medium to a sterile culture tube
  • add the appropriate amount of antibiotic(s)
  • use a sterile inoculation needle, pipette tip or toothpick to pick a colony from the Agar plate
  • gently whirl the tip in the medium (or drop it)
  • incubate at 37 °C and 230 rpm

components.data:
1:100 dilution of o/n cultures in microtiter (96-well) plate

 

  • pipet 99 µL fresh LB medium (incl. the appropriate antibiotic) into each well of the 96-well plate
  • add 1 µL of each o/n culture to the medium 
  • add 100 µL LB medium to 6 wells as blank 
  • overlay each well with 40 µL of mineral oil (to prevent evaporation)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1:100 dilution of o/n cultures in microtiter (96-well) plate

 

  • pipet 99 µL fresh LB medium (incl. the appropriate antibiotic) into each well of the 96-well plate
  • add 1 µL of each o/n culture to the medium 
  • add 100 µL LB medium to 6 wells as blank 
  • overlay each well with 40 µL of mineral oil (to prevent evaporation)

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 2 of Fluorometric real-time quantification of in vivo fluorescence in E. coli
source_data.protocol_name: Fluorometric real-time quantification of in vivo fluorescence in E. coli
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fluorometric real-time quantification of in vivo fluorescence in E. coli
source_data.annotation:
• pipet in a sterile or semi-sterile environment, i.e. in sterile hood, since also contaminants would have the chance to grow during the following o/n incubation   

 

• due to the autofluorescence of LB medium, you might prefer to use a mineral medium like M9 medium - note that the choice of media will significantly influence the growth characteristics and might require longer cultivation periods

source_data.affiliation: Department of Chemistry - Microbial Chemistry, Ångström Laboratory, Uppsala, Sweden

components.data:
• remove the lid from the microtiter plate
  • insert microtiter plate into plate reader device (e.g. Synergy Mx, Biotek)

 

Settings

 

Gain:  50

Absorbance: OD600 (8 measurements per data point)

 

Fluorescence GFP:   Excitation λ -  480/ 9 nm

                                  Emission  λ -  520/ 20 nm

 

Fluorescence YFP:   Excitation λ -  500/ 9 nm

                                  Emission  λ -  535/ 20 nm

 

Frequence of measurements: 5 min (241 reads, 10 measurements per data point)

 

Temperature:     37 °C

Agitation:           continuous 'medium mode'

Time:                 20 h
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• remove the lid from the microtiter plate
  • insert microtiter plate into plate reader device (e.g. Synergy Mx, Biotek)

 

Settings

 

Gain:  50

Absorbance: OD600 (8 measurements per data point)

 

Fluorescence GFP:   Excitation λ -  480/ 9 nm

                                  Emission  λ -  520/ 20 nm

 

Fluorescence YFP:   Excitation λ -  500/ 9 nm

                                  Emission  λ -  535/ 20 nm

 

Frequence of measurements: 5 min (241 reads, 10 measurements per data point)

 

Temperature:     37 °C

Agitation:           continuous 'medium mode'

Time:                 20 h

components.data:
• export data to .csv/.xlsx file 
  • substract blank (LB) values from both the fluorescence and the OD600 values
  • estimate relative fluorescence by dividing GFP/YFP-fluorescence by the corresponding OD600
  • the figure below depicts exemplary curves of relative YFP (mVenus) fluorescence accumulation over time in E. coli strain W3110  
    • the unit of measurement is

      relative mVenus fluorescence [Ex.:Em. 500:535nm * OD600-1]

       

  •  as a quantitative proxy for the expression dynamics calculate the slopes of relative fluorescence within the linear phase  of relative fluorophor accumulation 

 

  •  divide single values of relative fluorescence by the corrsponding value of the control group at a given time point, or a given OD600

  • substract blank (LB) values from both the fluorescence and the OD600 values
  • estimate relative fluorescence by dividing GFP/YFP-fluorescence by the corresponding OD600
  • the figure below depicts exemplary curves of relative YFP (mVenus) fluorescence accumulation over time in E. coli strain W3110

  •  as a quantitative proxy for the expression dynamics calculate the slopes of relative fluorescence within the linear phase  of relative fluorophor accumulation
